SENT.plain: The authors describe a case of cerebrovascular accident by syphilis in a 37 years-old man
The clinical features were headache, right hemiparesis and ptosis of the left eyelid
Blood and spinal fluid tests for syphilis were positive
The angiography showed a basilar trunk occlusion with revascularization of the cerebellar culmen
The autopsy disclosed a sub-total occlusion of the basilar artery and a fresh left cerebellar infarct
